turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about The Mission (band).
turn.1: What happened in 2009 with the band The Mission?
turn.2: In February 2009, the Mission's record label SPV records released a double album "Live & Last" plus the DVD "Final Chapter" recording of the final show which included additional footage from the tour.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: The DVD debuted in the official UK BBC charts at No.6 – the highest UK chart position in many years for the band.
turn.5: What happened in 2010 with the band?
turn.6: In June 2010 the band's label SPV released "Dum Dum Bullet", a collection of recordings taken from the "God is a Bullet" sessions As the 25th anniversary was approaching, it was suggested to Hussey that he should reform the original line-up of the band.
turn.8: The singer initially resisted, occupied with other projects.
turn.10: Eventually he was convinced and in the summer of 2010 the announcement was made that with Craig Adams and Simon Hinkler on board the Mission had reformed.
turn.12: Drummer Mick Brown had passed on the invitation to join and Spear of Destiny's Mike Kelly took his place.
